column4: In order to build the VPN kernel module, you must have the kernel headers for the version of the kernel you are running. Can someone tell me what this means??
it means you need to run: sudo aptitude install linux-headers-$(uname -r)
open a terminal and type in tat command exactly
you now have installed the headers it wants, so you can go on with the installer
you need to make a new directory and let it mount there
i tried what you said and it gave me a long list of options and then this "This command is designed to be run from within /bin/mount by giving
have you tried the places -> connect to server thing already?
yeah... it didn't work. That's why i called the school helpdesk and they told me to do it this way.
can you please talk to me in private and paste the exact command you used to try mounting
in a terminal you type this: sudo ln -s /usr/lib/libesd.so.0 /usr/lib/libesd.so.1
once again you're my savior. Thanks
